intro: Xolisma tuerckheimii, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It is a low-growing perennial that thrives in sandy and gravelly soils, often found in desert environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically covered in a fine layer of hair, which helps reduce water loss in hot, dry conditions. Xolisma tuerckheimii plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes and supporting local wildlife.
